poem:
### Eleven Arrested

Pigs' heads in the whispers of night,  
words sown in shadows, foreign-fingered,  
the stained trails lead to the mosque,  
past prophets' messages defaced,  
where echoes of ancient walls  
crumble under the weight of fear.  
In this dawn, eleven silenced tongues,  
but the air still tastes of ash and breath—  
learning the language of love.
